heaviest_rainfall.status: On 04 January 2025, a record rainfall of 36.8mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  4.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: On 02 September 2025, the rain fell at an exceptional rate, peaking at 27.0mm per hour, the heaviest downpour recorded.  A total of 21.19mm fell over the 15.0 hour storm.

longest_rain.status: Rain fell for 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 creating a new record that still lasts.  The storm produced a total of 36.8mm with a maximum intensity of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: Since 11 April 2025, the day with the most lightning strikes is 07 September 2025 when 23 were seen.

storm.status: No storms are expected.  The last storm was observed on 08 October 2025 and continued for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is no cold snap at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 cold snaps, with an average of 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is no heatwaves at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwavess, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical.status: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (191°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The top recorded wind gust is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1737 miles from 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 10.1°C), outside temperature (down 9.2°C), and inside temperature (down 3.5°C).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 373 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in outside temperature (up 10.7°C), cloud levels (up 355 m), and inside temperature (up 4.2°C) when compared to today.

Today’s average cloud levels is 372.8m lower than yesterday, 244.7m lower than the past week, 354.7m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 993m to 2630m and averaged 1249.7m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.

summary.summary: Inside; relatively cool weather. Outside; extremely cold temperatures will prevail. Also, very little to no wind will be present. A few light raindrops may fall, the sky may alternate between sunny and overcast, and it’s dark. Stable conditions are expected under a high pressure system.

washing.phrase: The current temperature is too low (1.3°C) for optimal drying conditions.  Any drying will take longer.
